website_summaries.verdict: Powerful, lightweight, fast, and surprisingly quiet. Absolutely the best car tire inflator out there.
pros: Handles everything from a beach ball to a 33-inch truck tire
Plenty of cable and hose for large RVs and king cabs
cons: Clips to battery rather than plugging in to cigarette lighter

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed and now need to reach out for warranty
customer_reviews.text: Leaking air straight out of the box when I needed to use it for the first time!!! Very disappointed and now need to reach out for warranty. After some fiddling I found that the air tube attachment near the handle broke. Be careful pushing down or putting pressure on the handle! I eventually tore it apart (useless warranty) and fixed it myself with hose clamps. Now it works great.
customer_reviews.author: D. Byun

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Got three uses out of it last year, then fired it up again this year after storing it in the basement and it will not work on both of my cars. The wires have not been stripped, the basement has a dehumidifier, and it hasn't been heavily used. I was very happy with the first year uses but since it didn't last literally a year or even a dozen uses I'm very unhappy with it. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Defective. It began to deflate my tire as soon as I attached it and continue to deflate my tire after I turned on its power. It does not generate enough pressure for my thumb. I can hold about 65 PSI with my thumbs so it's generating less than that. I bought it because of all the good reviews out here. I'm going to send it back and try one more. I may revise this review if the replacement one is better, but a defective one right off the bat is a black eye.
customer_reviews.author: Reno Ceferino

customer_reviews.title: Worked well the first time only
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine at home when i tested it but then when i was in the middle of no where ... failed! The compressor came on but did not have enough power to air up anything, including a air mattress. Had to return it and went with a solid name brand product.
customer_reviews.author: David Marta

customer_reviews.title: Died after 3 months / topping off 6 tires
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product in early July and used it on 4 occasions (twice on a Honda Civic, once on a Toyota Camry, and once on a Honda Odyessy van) over 3 months to top off a total of 6 tires (none of the tires were > 7 lbs below the recommended pressure). On the third tire of the Odyessy the compressor just stopped working. Nothing on it was hot to the touch, but the light wasn't on and nothing we did could revive. We tried to use it again 2 weeks later on my Civic but it still wouldn't come on. We contacted the company tonight about getting a replacement under the warrenty.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: Worked great then failed after a dozen uses.
customer_reviews.text: Airing back up is a total breeze now. UPDATE... I loved this for the Jeep. I'm on dirt a lot, using asphalt only when I have to. And of course failures ONLY happen far from home. So when the ride home was 90 miles, of course this unit failed, leaving me at 20psi in a modified YJ. (Is there any other kind?) So we carefully cruised back, pretty bummed that the compressor failed after only a dozen uses even when stored in a sealed bag. Then I read a review where a warranty was attempted but cost was more than the unit. Back to the drawing board for a compressor that will save a Jeeper when its needed.
customer_reviews.author: Behr

customer_reviews.title: Worked twice and died!
customer_reviews.text: I used it when I received it in March and again lour days ago to top up my RV's tires. I was impressed with it. Pulled it out today to add air to my lawnmower's tires and it refused to start. I checked the online fuse... it was blown. I replaced the fuse and it blew the new one, too. Of course, it's been more than 30 days since I received it so I cannot return it. Now all I have is an expensive paperweight. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Mike L

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful compressor, but it always blow fuses
customer_reviews.text: Good thing about this compressor is that it is powerful. It will inflate tires quickly. The bad thing is that it blows fuses on a regular basis. You're going to need a new fuse for every tire you inflate. I am not kidding. If you top off (4) tires, you are going to need (4) spare fuses. It got so bad, that I got a box of 25 fuses. In about 2 months, half of that box is gone. Just make sure you always have 4+ fuses on hand when you use this compressor.
customer_reviews.author: speed808

customer_reviews.title: Poor handle design breaks off nipple
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent little compressor, but mine broke on its third use. Part of the carry handle is supported on the nipple coming out of the compressor so just by carrying this or setting something on top of it all the weight is on that nipple and breaks it off. I also noticed that the gauge was always about 20 psi off from what the tire actually read leading to incorrect tire pressures. To warranty this out you pay $24 bucks shipping each way. I paid $50 for this so why wait weeks to get the same thing for the same price. I'll be throwing this away and buying a real quality compressor. No more viair junk.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Mann

customer_reviews.title: Love this compressor
customer_reviews.text: This compressor works great. I air down my tires quite often on long off road trips and this compressor works quickly to get me to proper road pressures. The bag it comes with seems of good quality. It also comes with a few extra nozzles, like a needle for a football, or a nozzle for an inflatable tube to float down the river. The psi gauge on the compressor doesnt seem to be super accurate but it's good enough for reference. I typically double check it with a handheld gauge. I'd recommend this to just about anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Has a long hose & battery direct.
customer_reviews.text: About 3.5 mins 16# to 35# on a 32"....this is good. (Jeep JK) Wicked hot after 1st tire....this is concerning! Battery direct with engine running...this is good. (Not a cig. lighter cheapo). Don't like that hose and power cord are not protected by any extra sheath where they enter the units housing. This is a stress area as they rub against the plastic container I carry it in and probably the first fail point with ify replacement opportunity. The bag it came in ...a TOTAL JOKE...why even bother Viair? That's why its 3* and not 5*.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Now comes with a carrying bag!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this compressor because of the brand name. I read sooo many positive reviews on their products. But unfortunately I can not afford some of their most expensive compressors. So I settled on this one but was bummed it didnt come with a carrying bag. I open the package and guess what???!!! IT NOW COMES WITH A CARRYING BAG!!! I haven't tried the compressor yet but I'm sure I wont be let down!
customer_reviews.author: DNS

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little pump
customer_reviews.text: I used this for refilling tires after track days in my Subaru BRZ and this works amazing. Just unpack the pump from its nice carrying bag, clamp onto the battery terminals, and then inflate your tires much faster and quieter than almost everything else available. The thread on air chuck, built in pressure gauge, and LED on light make inflation easy, and the pump works faster than any gas station air compressor I've used. The setup is light and compact enough to be easily hidden away in a trunk. Super happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kodama

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the box, I used it right away because other reviewers did not use until an emergency and then there were problems. I used it to fill the spares on two cars and topped off a spare in my truck. The spare in the truck was filled from 68 to 80 lbs (the required). The reason I bought this is because it advertised it will fill truck tires and it did. Noise was normal and the time it took to fill the tires seemed about right. The only reason it got 4 stars instead of 5 is because I need to use it more to really evaluate it. For now, I always carry it (and a plug kit).
customer_reviews.author: CS55

customer_reviews.title: A MUST for any off-roader
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 2019 Tacoma whenever the trail ends and pavement begins. I have 285s on my truck and went from 20 psi to 35 psi in about 2 minutes. Easy to use. Easy to store. Pumped up a flat volleyball in the blink of an eye. I paired this with ARB ARB505 E-Z Deflator Kit, now off-roading is marginally more efficient. The only drawback so far is that it gets pretty hot but that hasn't affected quality or performance. Overall, highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Pat R.

customer_reviews.title: Use it AT LEAST once a month.
customer_reviews.text: I use this little air compressor at least once a month to re air my tires after camping/wheeling trips. I consistently air 33" tires up on two vehicles each time with no issues and it only takes about 20 mins to air both vehicles back up. Compact, lightweight, long power cord and long air house. Fairly quiet and the gauge works well. I love this little air compressor and would highly recommend it to any offroader.
customer_reviews.author: Dakota C.

customer_reviews.title: worked well for light duty for 6 years
customer_reviews.text: Paid ~68 for this unit, in 2014 - stayed in a zippered bag in the car. Recently started blowing fuses, so opting to try the Dewalt unit as a replacement which seems more versatile. Gauge is actually fairly accurate while the unit it powered off. Not *too loud*, and is fairly quick to fill tires. I would be tempted to buy this unit again, if the Dewalt wasn't an option. Albeit the failed unit after 6 years of light duty is annoying - but how long do compressors usually last?
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Leader

customer_reviews.title: Really works - Buy this one for any car or SUV
customer_reviews.text: It's advertised to be applicable for a largish truck tire with high pressure inflation requirements. OK it is. But what it also is, is a pump that inflates a Highlander SUV tire (which is not a 33" tire and so on) without pause. It inflates very quickly and has a 25 minute duty cycle. Buy this one! Does a great job, it's quiet, and it's remarkably compact for its performance rating.
customer_reviews.author: PaulOne

customer_reviews.title: Good pump, but returned due to leaking hose connection.
customer_reviews.text: Low sound, great little compressor. I have had good luck with Viair in the past. However I had to return this one and haven't ordered a replacement. I need to be able to pump a 285/70/17 tire to 80 psi when towing. The pump I got was smoking, too hot to pick up and leaking where it screws on to the valve stem at the hose joint. Despite a 120psi rating I never could get above 68psi because of the fitting leak on the hose. If anyone knows a pump that will hit 80psi on my truck tires let me know.
customer_reviews.author: M|

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: This pump seems to be powerful enough for passenger tires and cross-over vehicles. I do not know about full size trucks and off-road tires. Must connect to car battery which is OK because you will have good power if you need to leave the car on also. The jump cable is a little thin so be careful not to have any moving engine parts involved. The air hose is sturdy and long enough to get to all four tires. The only issue is the connection is a screw on and not quick release. This is very secure but requires patience. Finally, would strongly recommend a dedicated PSI gauge as the one on the unit seems to be very limited.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bland

customer_reviews.title: Great pump for a trailer
customer_reviews.text: This little pump is convenient, pretty lightweight, and pumps tires up at a very acceptable rate. I use it primarily for my camp trailer--which is a 30' tow behind. With the included air hose and electrical wires stretched almost to their max, it can go from the tongue-mounted batteries to all four tires. But it can't reach the spare on the back bumper. This one doesn't come with a case, so I found a reasonably priced tool pouch on Amazon and it works fine. The finishes on this are nice--it looks like a legit tool vs. the crappy black plastic contraptions that cost less and probably don't work as well.
customer_reviews.author: S. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Very fast inflation!! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pump from reviews I read on the internet. My son owns a Jeep so I wanted a pump that could handle his tires. My other son had a flat on his Chrysler so I decided to make the purchase to use to inflate his tires. I hooked up the pump to his tire and turned it on. Within 1-1:15 minutes the tire was completely inflated to 35psi. The tire size was 215/55-R18. I could not believe how fast this pump works.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.

customer_reviews.title: Big things do come in small packages....
customer_reviews.text: Do not let size fool you here! This little f***** right here can pump out some air! In my factory 32" tires on 20" rims, it throws in 1psi every maybe 8 seconds. Before I used a crappy cigarette lighter pump and it ran for MINUTES to get 5psi,I accidentally ran this thing for about 1.5 minutes and it was up 10psi+! My truck tpms could not keep up with the air being thrown into the tire, it was lagging behind this pump (that's a good thing)! Very compact, easy to re-pack up after use....no more worries of being stranded with a flat!
customer_reviews.author: KingChoup17

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty air pump - Great for RVs!
customer_reviews.text: I own two of these air pumping beauties. One is in my Jeep Wrangler and the other is in my small motorhome. I've had no problem of overheating with this beast. It inflates larger RV tires with no problems. Note that to do this you have to use a direct connection to you car's battery with the clips to get the needed amperage. This is NOT like those cheaper, lighter units that plug into a cigarette lighter. That outlet does put out enough power for this beast. Also loved that the last one of these air pumps ordered came with it's own carry case. This one is a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: Audiophile Headcase

customer_reviews.title: Four stars 🌟
customer_reviews.text: I only gave it four stars because it is probably intended for one tire at a time. I just tested it to see if it works. I normally go off-roading and need it for four tires. I reduced the pressure down to 20 psi for just one tire. It took 2:30 to fill back to 40psi. It was also piping hot with just one tire. I just have a concern that It'll burn out if I try to do all four tires at once. You may have to let it cool some before continuing on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: HANDY AND EASY TO USE
customer_reviews.text: This in my opinion is a very necessary item to have in my Jeep, you may not use it on a regular basis but when you do have a problem and you are off road and no air pump around - you are happy to have. The cords and ease of use, plus the small space footprint makes this item in my opinion - glad I purchased and comfortable I have in my vehicle. I check my tires on a regular basis for both safety and tire wear reasons. However having this compressor, I can inflate tires right in my driveway and I do not have to search for cash to run to a service station to add air.
customer_reviews.author: JOSEPH BENDZINSK

customer_reviews.title: Super fast and quiet compressor!  Needs longer power cord.
customer_reviews.text: Overall I love this compressor. It is super fast and surprisingly quiet for a 12v compressor. My only complaint is the power cord is too short given you have to clamp it to your battery. With my truck, between the power cord and the hose length, it barely reaches my back tires. I bought it for my RV, so I have to use jumper cables to reach my RV's tires.
customer_reviews.author: Hombrenieve

customer_reviews.title: The head gets hot!
customer_reviews.text: This compressor works great so far. I like the long supple air hose and power cord that allows me to access all the tires on my 25ft. motorhome. The only concern is the compressor head gets very hot. It wouldn't take much to get a burn on your hand if you are not careful and grasp it there. I found out when it tipped and stopped it from falling over. How it holds up over the next few years is the real test. But right now, I'm happy with it's performance.
customer_reviews.author: Ran

customer_reviews.title: You want quality? Buy this item with extension a (if needed). You'll be happy
customer_reviews.text: Wow, powerful, quality, excellent air hose and battery clips line length. Aired up my RV 6 wheeler, and two cars and my bikes. Supper easy and relatively fast (definitely for bikes). Comes with a nice bag. I bought the inexpensive "part 0016) extension air hose, to provide me enough length to hit all tires on 6 wheel RV. I also contacted Viair customer support by email to ask if it could handle my RV tires. I ACTUALLY GOT A REPLY BACK IN LESS THAN 24 HOURS! Super good price. Great customer service, and quality product. I'm a happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: Jontona

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Air Compressor
customer_reviews.text: I did my research and this was rated one of the best. Seems to be very good quality. Gave it a test run and it worked great. Even the pressure gage matched my tire gage. Have to see how it lasts but hope to never need it much. About the only thing that was a little disappointing was the storage bag. Good luck getting every thing back in bag. Can be done but a real pain if your in a hurry. Ended up putting it into a bigger, rugged, waterproof, plastic boat box. Much better along with a spare fuse and hand pressure gage.
customer_reviews.author: MEB

customer_reviews.title: Strong Start, Weak Ending
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this compressor to replace another that had seal failures. It started strong and I was hoping for a couple years worth of security. It failed one week shy of its fourteen month anniversary. This unit was not subjected to hard use. It was used to air up tires in a couple of pick ups (regular size tires) and when tire patches/ repairs were made. The pump was only used once a month or so.
customer_reviews.author: ljfromnj

customer_reviews.title: Decent pump, inaccurate gauge
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Moves air quick. -Stores easily in a Rothco toolbag (standard size) -seems to be of a decent quality -drawing power straight from the battery is a plus Cons: -Pressure gauge is not accurate. It is off by ~ 10 PSI, which is outside an acceptable range. his means you need to check your pressure regularly with a more accurate gauge as you pump, which adds time.
customer_reviews.author: KayakFisherman

customer_reviews.title: What a fantastic product. I've used all sorts of battery-operated air ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow! What a fantastic product. I've used all sorts of battery-operated air compressors before and have always been disappointed. But this thing is a beast! I aired-up all four tires on my race car in less than 5 minutes. One note of warning here -- it does run hot, so don't touch the round top at the front of the compressor after it's been running for awhile, don't let it run continuously for more than about 15 or 20 minutes, and make sure it's thoroughly cooled down before you put it away.
customer_reviews.author: johnlee

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, would be nice if it had a bag
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little portable unit, has plenty of range between the cable and the long air hose, and fills tires quickly. But, being a portable unit, it would have been nice if it came with a little carrying bag, since it lives in the car. For now I will keep it in the original box until I randomly stumble across a little bag that fits it perfectly. It also "walks" quite a bit when it is running due to the vibrations despite having rubber feet.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan V

customer_reviews.title: Incomplete picture!!!
customer_reviews.text: I assumed the compressor came with a self coiling hose, THE PICTURE DOES NOT SHOW ANY HOSE!!!!! The bag is TOO small when one MUST carefully coil the hose as small as possible just to put everything in the too small bag. I would have bought a more expensive compressor knowing that it would take several minutes just to put everything in the too small bag, I'm thinking of returning the compressor & purchasing one with a self coiling hose. since this will not be used every day, I might just keep it. The vender needs to show the complete picture!!!!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: It’s so fast!
customer_reviews.text: I have a mini van and an suv and this cord has absolutely no issue reaching the rear of my tires at all. The only issue I have with this is the clips on the cords that connect to the battery are rather small. At times I thought the cord would come off of my car battery, I’ve used it 3 times already and not once had it failed me. This pump fills my tires up SO QUICK. The gauge is some what inaccurate. Usually off with 1. PSI, I have a gauge to test that. Best bang for my buck. EVER.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: 265/70/17 (31" tires). It takes 17 minutes to air up four tires from 14psi to 35psi. Test began when I stopped the vehicle and ended when I drove away. Test included unpacking and packing back up with neatly wound cables and hose.
customer_reviews.author: J. T. Buck

customer_reviews.title: High quality mini air compressors!
customer_reviews.text: Viaair compressors are of a quality level that is superior in general. I've owned late model craftsman and 35$ big box portables for in-car use, and this little unit is more capable and better engineered. Note that this unit is not a continuous run unit, like many portables, but manages my large pickup truck and my travel trailer tires (all at least 70psi) very well! Comes with nice carry case and toy inflators as well. This unit runs on 12 volts from running automobile!
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: This thing can save your hide in a pinch... it is no cheapo rip off inflator!
customer_reviews.text: I don't own an air compressor for my garage so I needed a portable, speedy and dependable way to inflate my tires. It's pretty quiet compared to the junky old one I had, it's very solidly built and I'd recommend it to anyone with a car! The only downfall, is the carrying case. The air hose, power cord and compressor are difficult and time consuming to put back in the bag.... making the air hose detachable at the base of the unit would help... but a bigger bag is really needed.
customer_reviews.author: David Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great little compressor
customer_reviews.text: I was always very skeptical of these compressors. I have burned them out in the past so went to using manual pumps. My activities take me into the wilderness so being able to deal with a flat tire is important. My past experience with these pumps is you listen to them run watch the gauge slowly move. This pump fills my tires in very little time. I didn't time how long it took to fill my tire, but, it sure didn't seem long. I like the long power cord and air-line.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney S. Shishido

customer_reviews.title: works for 34's...but
customer_reviews.text: have 295/60/R20 tires on a Toyota Tundra. theybare a 34 inch tire, this thing will fill them, however it takes a while from about 20psi to about 45psi. as the pump heats up, it takes even longer. first tire is decently fast, as you get to your 4th tire the time to get them to pressure is drastically longer. about 25 mins to fill all 4 tires from 20psi. I'd look for something a little more powerful if you're running 34's or larger.
customer_reviews.author: Army Guy

customer_reviews.title: Faster than cheaper brands.
customer_reviews.text: A nice long hose length. Is a screw on tire valve stem attachment (not a thumb lever). I had a Harbor Freight equivalent of this for many years. This one is quieter and faster. Has a longer hose too. Comes in a fabric case. The analog pressure gauge is at the compressor not at the valve stem end. So you have be at the compressor (body) to read the pressure. That is a bit inconvenient. The units body does gets very hot, most all competitive brands to anyways too.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Cicon

customer_reviews.title: Built like a tank!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Viair portable air compressor. My first one was larger and geared more towards large tires on our motorhome. Since we downsized to a travel trailer all I needed was this one to keep my truck and trailer tires at the proper pressure. Mine came with a carrying bag but I didn't like it because there was barely enough room for the compressor, hose and 12v cord. You have to roll up the hose and cord very tight to get everything in the bag. I decided to purchase the Rothco Mechanics Tool Bag and it is much easier getting everything in and out. Good quality bag. Thanks to others who suggested it.
customer_reviews.author: Smitty

customer_reviews.title: Surprised at how good this thing is!
customer_reviews.text: We travel in a 42 ft 5th wheel trailer and a Ram 3500 truck. Thus pump is light- comes in a travel bag even though the description says it doesn’t - and it works like a charm. It’s lightweight, strong, and had no trouble bringing our heavy duty trailer tires as well as our truck tires put to 100-110 PSI. We’ve only had it a few days but as frequent Amazon buyers , we tested it thoroughly when we got it. We are replacing a very large tank compressor that is heavy and needs electricity to use. This thing is GREAT. Don’t hesitate to try it.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Fast, but Gets HOT
customer_reviews.text: This pump is great for the price. I took my 2017 Tacoma to a dirt road that crosses a dry creekbed with softball sized rocks. I aired down to about 18 psi and crushed through the trail. I got back to the trailhead, and pulled out this pump and it took about 2-3 minutes per tire to get each tire back to 35 psi. Very happy with my purchase! Note: This thing gets hot AF so bring gloves or be super careful when handling. . . or both.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: It sems to work well
customer_reviews.text: I used the air compressor for the first time just today and it worked very well. I was happy to see that the cables are generously long enough to reach both rear tires of my Jeep Cherokee without moving the compressor. The pressure gauge is easy to see and it's accurate (measured against a digital pressure gauge). At first I wanted to buy a compressor that used the cigarette-lighter for power but, these long cables clipped onto the battery terminal easily and you don't have to be concerned about blowing a fuse. Using this air compressor was a snap....
customer_reviews.author: AMG

customer_reviews.title: Check Your Power Output Limits
customer_reviews.text: I received the VIAIR in good condition and happy I bought it. I hooked it to the battery contacts and it began working. I didn’t connect it to a tire yet because I didn’t need to. I specifically chose this product because it connects directly to the battery terminals. We often use the cigarette lighter to charge cellphones and I was concerned that any good portable air pump would blow the fuse to the cigarette lighter. The cigarette lighter fuse on my cars protect to 14 Amps. The max Amp draw from the VIAIR is 20 Amps.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Summers

customer_reviews.title: We thought the first one was just bad luck but when second one blew we figured it ...
customer_reviews.text: We have bought two of these and BOTH of them have blown internal seals conveniently after the one year warranty had expired. We used them to inflate trailer tires to 80lbs and both have blown seals. We thought the first one was just bad luck but when second one blew we figured it was just not up to the task. We will be looking for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D Garabedian

customer_reviews.title: Immediately bought a second one after the first one was stolen
customer_reviews.text: Owned my first one for years. Did a lot of research on pumps as I wanted one that would not break the bank while being able to bring my Toyota 4runner (now a Sequoia) tires back up to 32 psi after airing down to 15 psi for off road use. The 88P gets each tire back up to street pressure in about 3 minutes- making me a happy camper. After my car was broken into and all my offroad gear was stolen, this and my LiON jump box were the first 2 items I replaced. If you want a quality air compressor and don't want to break the bank- look no further.
customer_reviews.author: Christo Kuzmich

customer_reviews.title: Risk of burning up
customer_reviews.text: It will fill the rated tires eventually. This pump barely does the job. The problem is heat. As it heats up it pumps less, takes longer and heats up more. Used this to air up my 33" Nitto and almost melted in the Texas heat. This pump will work as a backup but not recommended for primary air.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Good but inaccurate and hot
customer_reviews.text: So I have used this pump a few times so far on my 33s for off-roading and has worked great so far. However when I air my tires to 37 (what my dash in my Jeep says) the gauge on the pump will say around 42, so it’s definitely off a bit. Secondly it does get very hot and airs the tires up verrrrryyyy slowly. About 4-5 mins a tire. I would say go for the 130 dollar smittybilt pump instead as it’s super fast and doesn’t get as hot. But this pump is still a great pump but it will burn the skin right off ur body after ur done using it if ur not careful.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Light, fast, affordable air on the go
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic little compressor. I have BFG KO2 tires - 265/75/16 - and normally run them at 35psi. I air them down to 20-25 psi when going off road, especially in soft sand for our local drive on beach. This compressor has a nice built in gauge; just attach the hose to the valve stem and you immediately see the pressure. Turn it on and let it inflate for a bit, then turn it off to see the pressure again without removing the hose. Takes me about 40 seconds of inflation to go from 20psi to 35psi on my tires. The unit does get pretty warm, but given the size and output it's not bad at all. Super light and portable.
customer_reviews.author: David Alison

customer_reviews.title: Buy with confidence!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for wheeling and airing down. It does heat up but I can pump up 4 tires without having to give it a rest to cool down. This thing is way better than the mv50 compressor I had that had nothing but problems. Buy with confidence. Especially at around $50 it cannot be beat! For storage, I opened up a Milwaukee plastic case that my drill came in and keep it in that. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Ty6897

customer_reviews.title: Fills  RV Tires to 110 psi!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 88P for the purpose of keeping the tire pressure of my 5th wheel RV up to the required 110 psi. The pressure was just below 100 psi on all four tires. It took approximately 2 minutes at the most to put the 10+ psi in each tire. Very impressive. The only negative is I wish the cord or hose (or both) would be about 10 feet longer and that a dual chuck could be attached. My 88P came equipped with a storage bag. The description did not state that a bag was included which was another plus!
customer_reviews.author: Steve and Maryann

customer_reviews.title: Best portable compressor I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: I will never go back to the cheap, low-power compressors I used to have. This thing is a beast. It's not very loud, but it will fill tires and other inflatables with authority. The build quality is great all around. It can get a little hot while running, but I don't think it's outside of the normal operating range. We've had this for about a year and have filled everything from small tricycle tires to 33" tiers on my truck. Great for all jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: I wish I’d bought this years ago
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had some very bad experiences with the gas station compressors in my area. Those days are now behind me. This little machine is fast, easy to use, and feels quite sturdy. My only complaint is that I wish there was a little more room to maneuver between the red and black clamps on the power cable. My car’s battery is in the trunk and it has ports in the engine bay. I was barely able to connect the ground clamp while also connecting the red clamp to the positive battery port.
customer_reviews.author: Fire Water

customer_reviews.title: Great product and Great Customer service!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this over a year ago and have been very happy. Several months ago, it developed a leak near the brass-hose connector. I wasn't sure why this is, so I emailed VIAIR to let them know of my problem. Their customer representative was able to identify the problem quickly and sent an o-ring that either was missing or fell out. I installed the o-ring and it WORKED! I have had the pleasure of owning a very reliable and powerful air compressor and also had the opportunity to experience VIAIR's top customer service. Because of this, I decided to upgrade my VIAIR compressor and purchased a second one (300p). I will definitely recommend this to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Q

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, easy to stow.
customer_reviews.text: First off don't buy a 12v compressor that plugs into the "cigarette lighter" maybe back when everyone smoked the cig-plug circuit was up to the task of powering a compressor. If your car was built in the last 30 years or so, chances are you will only blow fuses trying to use one. This one comes with battery clips and gets the job done. It appears to be well made and I hope that it last. I also like that it comes with a storage bag.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmyo

customer_reviews.title: Quickly fills up my 31" tires
customer_reviews.text: This was awesome in Moab! I used it three times to fill up my 31x10.50r15 tires from 15psi up to 35psi. The thing does get hot so definitely follow the guide about not letting it run for too long before giving it a break and such. But it only took a few minutes to fill up all of my tires each time. The weather was a bit warm, not crazy hot, but it worked well in the weather. I'm super impressed with this little air compressor!
customer_reviews.author: teewuane

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Like the loud sound of the motor. Sounds heavy duty. Have only used it a few times. As others have stated, the gauge isn’t the most accurate. It reads higher than actual pressure by upwards of 8psi (reading 43psi when actually 35psi). I just make sure to overfill slightly then take a reading with a separate pressure gauge and release a little air as needed. Did get hot when used on 3 of the 4 tires on my truck (LT265/70R17).
customer_reviews.author: Joesjunglegym

customer_reviews.title: Metal case gets RED HOT
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pump based on the reviews and because I didnt want a flimsy pump that would break. This is a solidly built pump but the metal housing gets red hot while you are using it. I'm talking you can burn the crap out of your hands if you are not careful. Do I have a defective product? Maybe That's up to the manufacturer to tell all of us here. I can not recommend anyone buy this pump
customer_reviews.author: Tom I

customer_reviews.title: Gets pretty hot but did pump up my tires
customer_reviews.text: I used this for my RV tires on a recent trip. I lowered the pressure in my tires for the sand and then needed to blow them up again. It took awhile for each tire and I had to "rest" it a few times for each tire as well as between tires. So, it took pretty long. The gauge does not seem to be right on but close enough. Cord length and hose was fine for me - my batteries are under the entry to the RV and it was long enough to reach my rear wheels. I did like the screw on valve as it allows you to connect it and then operate the pump.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Slavensky

customer_reviews.title: Insane Value
customer_reviews.text: I have used this about 10 times now to fill up 265/75/r16 tires (31.6"). It fills each time in about 4 minutes from 18 to 32 psi. It does get hot on the metal so do not pack with the plastic cords until it cools down. For the price this thing is a great value. Only complaint is that the psi gauge is not accurate enough. I find it to read be about 3 psi too high. But once you figure out how much it is off by you know how much to fill to so it's not a big issue.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: Appears well built and effective
customer_reviews.text: The 88P works great and inflates my 31" off road tires (up 15psi) relatively quickly. As others have stated, the compressor does get extremely hot on extended use i.e. in my case after inflating four tires 15psi. I am extremely happy with the Viair for it feels well built and runs quiet. I think for the money, its hard to beat. My only complaint is the hose is permanently attached and doesn't appear it can be swapped out easily.
customer_reviews.author: Ket Lim

customer_reviews.title: Great design, powerful, nice bag too.
customer_reviews.text: I have only tried this twice, just be sure it works. IT WORKS! I forget what the sale page said about air pressure for this one. I think it was no more than 75PSI. But when it arrived there was warantee card that reads that the warantee is voided if run past 1120PSI.Good to know! The cord/hose length will allow filling of all my RV tires from a single 12V cigar lighter. Now That Is Great!
customer_reviews.author: Geobo

customer_reviews.title: Worked as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: I read tons of reviews before buying this because my "other" cheap air compressor failed. It works great. I used it the other day to air up my wife's tires, which we all about 5psi low due to the temperature change. It took less than a minute per tire to top them off. I used it today on my truck (same thing), and it took a bit longer, but the tires have to be at least 3-4 times larger. Overall very impressed. It does get hot on the compressor end, but not a big deal. Gauge seems to be accurate. Recommend without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: MFFJM

customer_reviews.title: Solid Build
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a $57 pump purchased from a local car parts store. It was junky plastic. The cigarette lighter plug broke a few years ago; I could still make it work, but it was a bit dangerous. The Viair was only a little more expensive and carries 10 times the quality. If feels like it should be in a tool shed, as opposed to in a toy-box, like the other car tire compressors. Skip the plastic, digital toy air compressors.
customer_reviews.author: Scott W. Brians

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: This unit is great. I go off-roading and need to air the tires back up when I get back to pavement. This is a great jump up from the cigarette lighter pumps. The cord and hose is long enough to reach all the corners. It is faster than I thought it would be. Fits under the seat. Would like to get a quick chuck as screwing the hose on each tire is bit of pain. Still, great unit and it is durable. Well made.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara A

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, works great, but carry a pressure gauge with it.
customer_reviews.text: Great compressor - it fills my truck tires faster than I expected, and has come in handy a few times in the last couple months I've had it. It feels solid and well constructed, and I like that it connects directly to the battery instead of the cigarette lighter. The only issue is that the gauge is not accurate, but I always have a good quality gauge in the truck with me anyway so it's not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Dory

customer_reviews.title: Okay product
customer_reviews.text: Not giving it five stars because of the lack of plug-in versatility. I had not noticed when I ordered the product that it only came with battery clippers. I would have thought that the product would also come with the battery plug-in adapter too to make more versatile. My bad, but something to think about before you purchase same. Especially if your car battery is one these that is hard to find.
customer_reviews.author: Orlando.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product
customer_reviews.text: The product does exactly what it says it will do. The highest pressure I needed was 80psi on a 1 ton truck. Does that job flawless. The only thing I see this missing would be a base. It would have to be removable so as it still stores in such a small bag. This is must if you own a RV/Camper or trailer. I can almost store this in my glove box. This compressor is compact.
customer_reviews.author: bswanney

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: In place of the $300 air pumps that are offered by ARB and others, I got this and am satisfied with it. As an off-roader (2015 Jeep JK, 33" tires) I am frequently airing down and airing up. This pump does the trick, though after inflating 4 tires from 25 lbs to 40 lbs it is pretty hot. I do try to give it a break in between tires so that I don't overheat it. For the money, you can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Reliability when you need it!
customer_reviews.text: Knowing I was going on a long road trip last month, I knew a quality portable pump would come in handy. Sure enough, while two states away while visiting my brothers, I noticed one of my truck tires going flat. So, I pulled it out to use for the first time and it worked beautifully; reliability and and simplicity combined with quality. What more can one want? Worked like a champ so I could get to the tire shop the next morning.
customer_reviews.author: Jon M. Higley

customer_reviews.title: Great product, clearly better quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace (after the first day) another pump that never worked correctly right out of the box. Night and Day quality difference between the two. This is quieter, faster, the hose is long and of higher quality, the battery clamps are also of good quality. (the other one had a in cab DC plug that seemed to work fine also. There is a big difference between brands of these pumps.
customer_reviews.author: Phil C.

customer_reviews.title: Viair unit refills in just a few minutes and is pretty quiet compared to cheapo
customer_reviews.text: Had a small, cheap portable air compressor. Did some light off roading and lowered the air pressure just a few pounds. Cheap couldn't refill the tires, even after 45 min of trying. Viair unit refills in just a few minutes and is pretty quiet compared to cheapo. Wish it came with a case but still, Very pleased. Glad I found out the cheapo couldn't actually fill a plugged flat tire BEFORE I need too! With the Viair I am prepared.
customer_reviews.author: 4Jeeperz

customer_reviews.title: Let's try Viair
customer_reviews.text: Using this as a compressor for air horns. My last two pumps where the red ones from MF. First one lasted 9 years, second one didn't last 2 so figured I'd try a different brand. This model seems quieter and faster than that other brand and it is also smaller. The air hose is integrated so you can't swap hoses or tips. Should do fine for its purpose but time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: A Concerned Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great air compressor, but still has room for improvement
customer_reviews.text: The good: It is fast at inflating my tires, pretty quiet, comes with the battery terminal hook up built in, and a longer duty cycle. The bad: The gauge isn't accurate when pumping tires around 32 psi. I find myself pumping it a minimum of 4 psi past my intended stop. Also, I dislike having to walk back to the pump to turn it on when connecting the rear tires up. My last Viair pump had the cig. lighter connector with an adapter for the battery, making it long enough to walk with it all the way to my rear tires. This makes measuring the psi with an accurate gauge and then pumping more air if needed, faster and easier.
customer_reviews.author: Q. Vo

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I had four low tires on my vehicle and one almost flat on my boat trailer. I could not even get the trailer to a station in order to fill it up. Besides getting air in a gas station is a major pain. I took care of the four tires on the vehicle in just a few minutes. The almost flat trailer tire was inflated to 65 pse in 6 to 7 minutes. The gauge reads a little high when filling the tires. It is an easy task to turn it off and get an accurate read and then add a few more pounds as needed. One of the best products I have bought.
customer_reviews.author: wildchinook

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product works really well I bought one first and it worked really well I bought another one one thing I do think they can improve on but maybe there’s a way to do it I’m not sure but instead of hooking it up to the battery maybe try to get an adapter to just hook it into a cigarette lighter it’ll be easy opening up the hood to hook up to the battery Other than that it works well
customer_reviews.author: Michael A Ferraro

customer_reviews.title: One of my best auto related buys this year.
customer_reviews.text: We have six cars in the family. I believe in being well prepared while on the road. When not in use it stays in a road trip emergency kit that comes along with us on trips. Just be sure to observe the duty cycle - I believe it's 8 minutes of cool down for every 1.5 minutes of use. When it's available at home this compressor gets used constantly. I plan to buy each of my sons one for Christmas this year.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M.

customer_reviews.title: First impressions are good. I'll use it for awhile and update.
customer_reviews.text: I just got this today. I have yet to use it and this is just a first impression review. I'll update my review after I use it for some time. First impressions are good. The main working parts and housing are metal, the extra do dad's are plastic. The wire lead on mine has a 20 amp fuse in line and the clips fit into my battery booster plug, so no need to lift the hood. The airline seems okay, but it is attached in a way that seems permanent, lame if you want to add a air fitting to use your own hose set up. Has a on/off switch and power/work led.
customer_reviews.author: Scouter

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and fast
customer_reviews.text: This is all the compressor you need to fill up car tires. Takes a tire from 30 to 40 psi in a few minutes. Negative - The gauge on it while usefull is off 8 pounds. When it says 40 PSI its really 32-33psi. When it says 50 PSI its really 40 ish. I checked it against three other gauges. So do not trust its gauge. But its fill speed and size make up for the cheap gauge. Don't run these over a like 10 minutes straight if you want them to last. They are oiless and can't take long runs. It says max 35 minutes but that is pushing it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Jones

customer_reviews.title: I have used it a few times when checking tire pressure and it pumps pretty fast for being so small
customer_reviews.text: I do not have a garage where I can store tools, so I need to have everything in my trunk whenever I road trip. My '82 Firebird has a little compartment in the left rear wheel well which this fits perfectly in. I have used it a few times when checking tire pressure and it pumps pretty fast for being so small. It does get quite (painfully) hot when used for more than a minute, so I'm not sure about the longevity of it, but I don't use it too frequently, so it'll probably last several years.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Works Great.
customer_reviews.text: Had a different compressor that didn't last Scotty Kilmer recomends this one and says it's built to last. He doesn't do endorsements, and he's been on-point so far with everything else I've learned from the man. I expect this to hold up. I've used it only a few times so far. I'll update if it fails prematurely.
customer_reviews.author: RA

customer_reviews.title: Very nice inflator.
customer_reviews.text: I have not had this for long but used it a few times and it's awesome. The cord/hose length is long enough to reach anywhere on my truck. The flow rate is high enough to fill my 5 gal air tank to 100psi in about 2 minutes. It may not have the auto shut off that some of the new ones have but it's simple and works like a champ. I also like that it comes with a storage bag and the accessories have holders on the compressor.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Lancrain

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Traveling on stone roads regularly. Idiots put limestone down in large chunks to repair the roads and turned my $250 tires into Swiss cheese. After having to replace 2 tires I bought my own kit and this compressor and had to repair 5 more punctures through my 4 tires. Finally I managed to have the road fixed and next time the issue happens won't have to worry about a flat again
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: surprisingly good
customer_reviews.text: great little compressor for your vehicle. I only aired up several lower pressure tires so I can't speak to some monster truck application. it isn't at all loud like I feared it would be. it topped off 7 tires one right after the other. I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: chester

customer_reviews.title: Does its job
customer_reviews.text: I use this for inflating the tires of my jeep to get them back to a hard pavement PSI level after a day spent off road. Overall, good purchase. Great for someone new to off-roading, or for keeping in the truck for soccer practice. There are much better options out there for my particular application, but not at this price point. It'll get the job done without breaking the bank, and that's about it. The Good - Long tube and cables - Compact - Price The Alright - Flimsy, but appreciated bag - Somewhat loud - Slow to inflate larger tires The Bad - Gets VERY hot - Inaccurate pressure gauge (mine is off by a couple PSI)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exceeding Expectations
customer_reviews.text: Mine came with a cloth travel bag even though the description here said it would not, which is great. I’ve used the pump several times with no issue. It gets hot, but I haven’t had it overheat and shutoff yet. The hose seems to be high quality and the cables are long—just what you need. It’s earned a permanent spot in my vehicle thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Customer2

customer_reviews.title: best little pump this side of world
customer_reviews.text: this air pump has served me well , i've seen people asking on how long does it take to fill a tire. i'll give you this example 265/70r17 i air down my tires for driving on sand to 15 psi ... it takes about 3 minutes to fill that size tire to 34 psi it is small enough to stow away in a small bag. the hose it comes with is a nice length. its not to loud , seems to be well made. it will get pretty hot after some use so be careful handling it. niceguy approved!
customer_reviews.author: niceguy

customer_reviews.title: like 10 min a tire
customer_reviews.text: Takes a really long time, like 10 min a tire, and gets really hot for filling up 32" tires. Went up to 33" tires and it's pretty much worthless. It just gets so hot and won't go up in pressure any more. Friends are compressors fill up all 4 tires before I've filled one halfway up. Would not recommend for a truck or SUV sized tire, might be good for small car tires.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great to have on hand
customer_reviews.text: Two of the closest gas stations to my home did not have working air stations. I bought this because I was going on vacation and wanted something small to have in the trunk in case of emergency. I did use it on my spare vehicle. It took about 6 minutes to inflate a complete flat to 35psi and the unit got hot but worked well. My wife thought it was a hassle to have to pop the hood and connect to battery to use the product. I found that it works and will keep in my car. I will probably get my wife a jump starter with built in air compressor for her minivan.
customer_reviews.author: Thinh N.

customer_reviews.title: Works great and very compact
customer_reviews.text: Most public Air Compressors only go up to 55 PSI or so. We have 20" tires on our 2500 Truck so Viair works great for us! This air compressor is very compact and comes in a nice canvas case. Works by attaching provided alligator clip cables to the positive and negative battery terminals on your vehicle. Easy to use and very effective!
customer_reviews.author: Angie C.

customer_reviews.title: Great pump!  Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! I use it to fill my over size truck tires and travel trailer tires all of which need to be filled to 80 psi. I bought this unit after getting a cheap china made one that arrived broken. So glad I got this one instead. Fills the tires fast. 70 psi to 80 psi took about 2 mins the other day. Long cord and hose. I do wish it came with a bag as it says on the video from the manufacturer that “all our pumps come with a bag.” Though I kept the box and that has been working for now.
customer_reviews.author: camgo

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate gauge
customer_reviews.text: The pump part of the compressor seems fine. The pressure gauge, however, when the pump is running, reads way off; I was seeing 40psi when the static pressure just before and after removing the pump was more like 32psi, both on the pump's gauge and a separate gauge. So it's essentially impossible to know when to stop pumping.
customer_reviews.author: scf

customer_reviews.title: Very fast, high quality compressor.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic little compressor. This thing is FAST! But I wish they'd used a quality flip-lever valve connector on it, as the screw connector is a bit inconvenient. The built-in gauge is very accurate. Almost gave it 4 stars instead of 5 only because it doesn't include a carrying bag like most of their other models, but it's such a great compressor that I gave it 5 anyway.
customer_reviews.author: backwoodsman

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and well made
customer_reviews.text: Works really well to inflate my BF Goodrich all terrain KO2 285/70 R17/ tires. I beach ride and deflate the tires before riding and this inflates them easily. The cord is long enough to reach all around my Large SUV.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne D

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our 32 foot RV - four years strong.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this four years ago in September 2016 and it's still running great. Our RV has the large truck tires that need 65 PSI and this compressor handles that with no problem. It gets hot doing so, but does not overheat. The cord length plus the hose length can easily run from the battery in the front of the RV to the rear tires 23 feet back. I also like that it clips directly to the battery terminals and has an in-line fuse (never blown); other compressors that use the cigarette lighter were constantly blowing car/RV fuses.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Lesko

customer_reviews.title: HIGH QUALITY DURABLE
customer_reviews.text: If you ever bought those cigarette lighter plug ins for source of power..they are what's a good word, FUBAR This one goes directly to your car/truck battery, even use it in your shop w another car battery. It still works...THIS DOES HAVE A FUSE IN THE CABLE. SO NO NEED TO WORRY ABOUT THOSE FUSES in your vehicle's like before w those cigarette lighter plug ins. It inflates quickly a couple minutes each tire. Only thing it does not have is a tire pressure gauge. Other than that no complaints
customer_reviews.author: B. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Worked well when I needed it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this a couple weeks ago as a just-in-case item to keep in my trunk. I didn't actually use it for the first time until yesterday. I was on the way to a business meeting and hit a piece of metal debris on the highway that I couldn't avoid. Punctured my right front tire. Limped into a gas station parking lot and had to put on the little doughnut emergency tire, which was not fully inflated. Pulled out this air compressor, hooked it up, and I was on my way to the dealership to get a new tire after about 5 minutes. Worked great. Did what it's supposed to do in a reasonable amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

product_meta.title: Viair 00088 88P Portable Air Compressor
product_meta.description: Style:Air CompressorThe Viair 88P is a small portable compressor capable of inflating up to 33-inch tires using a direct battery connection with two battery terminal clamps. Tire pressure can be monitored using the gauge mounted on top of the unit, by temporarily switching the unit off. User manual information on color box, use color box for storage. Maximum Ambient Temp: +158 degree fahrenheit and Minimum Ambient Temp: -4 degree Fahrenheit.
feature_bullets: 12 VOLT - 120PSI Max Working Pressure, engine must be running during use.
1.47CFM Free Flow @ 0 PSI.Max. Amp Draw: 20 Amps
Portable air compressor powered via alligator clamps direct to battery.
Good for small ATVs, trucks, SUVs, and sedans with up to 33" Tires.
LED/Power indicator, 10 Ft. Power Cord, 16 Ft. Air Hose, 3pc Inflation Tip Kit

specifications.Cover Included: 12 Ft. Air Hose, Air compressor, 120 PSI Pressure Gauge, Solid Brass Twist-on Tire Chuck, 3 pc. Inflation Tips Kit, LED/power indicator, 9 Ft. Power Cord, Dual Battery Clamps
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars3,204 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
